snippet: The thorny question of historical accuracy, which continues to dog “Selma,” promises to be evergreen.
abstract: Cara Buckley The Carpetbagger column examines potential reasons why Rev Martin Luther King Jr biopic Selma was not nominated for best director and actor at the Oscars, despite receiving best picture nod; holds that film may have been hurt by poor campaign tactics and controversy over its historical accuracy, though several historically dubious films have won in the past.
lead_paragraph: The thorny question of historical accuracy, which continues to dog “Selma,” promises to be evergreen.

headline.print_headline: When Films and Facts Collide in Questions
headline.seo: ‘Selma’ Questions Are Nothing New for Historical Films
